content:
• Friday, October 14, 2011
  • S

    Sprint (NYSE:S) issues a statement saying it's recorded "its best ever day of sales in retail,...

    Sprint (NYSE:S) issues a statement saying it's recorded "its best ever day of sales in retail, Web and telesales for a device family in Sprint history with the launch of iPhone 4S and iPhone 4." Shares +1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • NOG

    Northern Oil and Gas (NOG +6.5%) finishes strong after being initiated with an Outperform at...

    Northern Oil and Gas (NOG +6.5%) finishes strong after being initiated with an Outperform at Raymond James, which notes leverage to the Bakken shale and the strategic advantages of it being a non-operator.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • HAR

    Harman International Industries (HAR +9%) pushes to the top of the S&P leader board after...

    Harman International Industries (HAR +9%) pushes to the top of the S&P leader board after investment firm Relational Investors and California State Teachers' Retirement System buy ~3.9M shares, saying they view the stock as "undervalued."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • SRPT

    AVI BioPharma (AVII -15.4%) tanks after it says the U.S. Department of Defense told the company...

    AVI BioPharma (AVII -15.4%) tanks after it says the U.S. Department of Defense told the company its proposal for the full clinical development of its influenza drug candidate, AVI-7100, didn't qualify for a contract award.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • BHGE

    Despite their strong performance on the rising price of crude today, BMO downgrades the oil...

    Despite their strong performance on the rising price of crude today, BMO downgrades the oil drillers, saying there is rising evidence that expected growth for 2012 "requires trimming." The following are cut to market perform: Baker Hughes (BHI +5.6%), Nabors (NBR +3.8), Noble (NE +2.7%) and Rowan (RDC +3.2%) (I, II, III, IV).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (OVTI -9.2%) shares plunge after a Chipworks examination of the image sensor in the...

    OmniVision (OVTI -9.2%) shares plunge after a Chipworks examination of the image sensor in the new iPhone 4S (AAPL +2.8%) eight-megapixel camera reveals it is Sony’s (SNE -0.4%), not OmniVision’s. It was expected that the image sensor product would be dual-sourced with Sony.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • JBHT

    J.B. Hunt Transport Services (JBHT +8%) holds on to solid gains after its Q3 profit jumped 32%...

    J.B. Hunt Transport Services (JBHT +8%) holds on to solid gains after its Q3 profit jumped 32% Y/Y as the trucking company saw revenue growth across the board, with particular strength in its intermodal division.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • ALNY

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +4.5%) gains after Rodman & Renshaw initiates the shares at...

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +4.5%) gains after Rodman & Renshaw initiates the shares at market outperform on valuation, saying it has a clear technological lead and strongest patent position in the RNAi space."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed Technology (RVBD +7.3%) rises after positive analyst notes this morning. Lazard touts...

    Riverbed Technology (RVBD +7.3%) rises after positive analyst notes this morning. Lazard touts the benefits of RVBD's new Cascade product for network performance management, on track for $40M in revenue and $100M by 2015. Also, ThinkEquity believes the stock should be bought ahead of RVBD’s Oct. 19 Q3 report because expectations are too low.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • ADTN

    Adtran (ADTN +4.5%) gains after Jefferies ups the shares to buy from hold, saying recent stock...

    Adtran (ADTN +4.5%) gains after Jefferies ups the shares to buy from hold, saying recent stock weakness makes for a compelling risk/reward scenario.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • TVIAQ

    Solayzyme (SZYM +13%) soars on above-average volume, as it tries to stage a comeback from a down...

    Solayzyme (SZYM +13%) soars on above-average volume, as it tries to stage a comeback from a down 55% YTD performance. The company may have caught a break after VC and previous-backer Vinod Kholsa announced he raised over $1B for new investments into clean tech companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 1 Comment

  • Shares of Local.com (LCOM +11.8%) spike, apparently getting a boost from a Seeking Alpha post...

    Shares of Local.com (LCOM +11.8%) spike, apparently getting a boost from a Seeking Alpha post discussing a "significant" patent the company received this month for a localized product search system. The patent, originally filed in 2007 but just granted, sounds a lot like Groupon and other local deals sites.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • PPDI

    Pharmaceutical Product Development (PPDI +1%) pops after its SEC filing reveals that it's...

    Pharmaceutical Product Development (PPDI +1%) pops after its SEC filing reveals that it's entered into a separate confidentiality agreement with another party other than Carlyle and Hellman & Friedman, potentially sparking a bidding war for the company. Earlier this month, the company had agreed to an all cash buyout offer from the two firms at $33.25 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • GLBR

    Forex trading firm FXCM takes a -12.6% hit after reporting disappointing monthly metrics late...

    Forex trading firm FXCM takes a -12.6% hit after reporting disappointing monthly metrics late yesterday. In its report, the company notes that "revenue per million continues to be constrained by low interest rates and increased trading from high volume, lower margin clients." Citigroup cut the shares to sell on the news, saying 2012-2013 consensus estimates for the company are too high.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • KATE

    Liz Claiborne (LIZ +4%) continues to power higher after Moody's announced late yesterday it was...

    Liz Claiborne (LIZ +4%) continues to power higher after Moody's announced late yesterday it was putting the company's debt on review for a possible upgrade. The stock has gained over 45% this week after disclosing the sale of its namesake brand to J.C. Penney (JCP +0.3%%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • AAPL

    ISI Group initiates coverage on the IT hardware and data networking sectors following the recent...

    ISI Group initiates coverage on the IT hardware and data networking sectors following the recent appointment of Brian Marshall as the company's technology team leader. His top picks in the space are Apple (AAPL +2.3%) and EMC (EMC +2.3%), noting that "tremendous negativity" is currently factored into the value of these companies, and today's entry price will ultimately prove attractive over the next 6-12 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • CY

    Ramtron (RMTR -8%) takes a hit after it says that its CFO Mark Kent has resigned for unspecified...

    Ramtron (RMTR -8%) takes a hit after it says that its CFO Mark Kent has resigned for unspecified reasons. Controller Gery Richards will serve as interim CFO as the company searches for a permanent replacement.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • PTEN

    Patterson-UTI Energy (PTEN +1.7%) trades higher on the back of a +2.8% gain in crude oil today,...

    Patterson-UTI Energy (PTEN +1.7%) trades higher on the back of a +2.8% gain in crude oil today, shrugging off a BMO downgrade to market perform. The firm cut the shares earlier due to a reduced oil price outlook and lower estimates for FY12 international growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • IBM

    IBM (IBM +1.2%) hits an all-time high after Collins Stewart raises its price target on the...

    IBM (IBM +1.2%) hits an all-time high after Collins Stewart raises its price target on the shares to $210 from $200 and Macquarie initiates coverage with an Outperform rating and a $210 price target. In a volatile macro environment, IBM's steadiness has appeal, Stifel Nicolaus says, with "several levers" at its disposal to support earnings if revenues are pressured.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • SKX

    Options traders could be contributing to the downward swing in Skechers (NYSE:SKX), off 4.3%,...

    Options traders could be contributing to the downward swing in Skechers (NYSE:SKX), off 4.3%, according to optionMonster's David Russell. Option activity 5X normal activity on the stock was highlighted by a bearish bet with the 3K contract purchase of November 14 puts and the sale of an equal number of November 15 calls by one trader.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • SONC

    Sonic (SONC +1.8%) trades higher after authorizing a $30M stock buyback, as the company takes...

    Sonic (SONC +1.8%) trades higher after authorizing a $30M stock buyback, as the company takes advantage of a 39% decline in price since hitting a 52-week high in April.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • WBS

    Webster Financial (WBS -4.8%) Q3 beat estimates on an 87% Y/Y jump in profit, due in large part...

    Webster Financial (WBS -4.8%) Q3 beat estimates on an 87% Y/Y jump in profit, due in large part to a sharp reduction in loan-loss provisions plus lower interest expenses. However, the stock is trading lower as the company notes challenges to sustaining earnings growth given the slowing economy and margin pressures ahead.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM

  • Markets are selling off just a bit on a Bloomberg report that the EU is considering allowing a...

    Markets are selling off just a bit on a Bloomberg report that the EU is considering allowing a 50% haircut on Greek debt, combined with a bigger backstop for banks and more ECB sovereign debt purchases. The July 21 agreement that was just ratified with so much fuss called for a 21% writedown. Stoxx 50 +0.9% after being 2% higher earlier..
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 17 Comments
  • TIVO

    TiVo (TIVO +4.6%) shares are jumping following a key ruling late yesterday in the...

    TiVo (TIVO +4.6%) shares are jumping following a key ruling late yesterday in the company’s patent infringement suit against AT&T (T +0.1%). Lazard says the court sided with TiVo in issuing a key definitional ruling that is “consistent with our view that AT&T will see a high chance of losing and so will likely enter into a favorable settlement with TiVo.”
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • PIR

    Pier 1 Imports (PIR +2.6%) announcement earlier this morning of a $100M stock repurchase seems a...

    Pier 1 Imports (PIR +2.6%) announcement earlier this morning of a $100M stock repurchase seems a bit of an anomaly in this recent buyback frenzy. Whereas most companies have been initiating buybacks to take advantage of price weakness, Pier 1 is trading near the high-end of its 2-year trading range.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • GCI

    Gannett (GCI -1.2%) trades lower after Benchmark slashes its estimates and PT for the media...

    Gannett (GCI -1.2%) trades lower after Benchmark slashes its estimates and PT for the media company ahead of Monday's Q3 results, citing expectations of a 7% decline in newspaper ad sales, given weak macro conditions. Benchmark also sees broadcasting ad sales declining 11%, but expects them to rebound in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • P

    Shares of Pandora (NYSE:P) stay undaunted in the face of competition from larger rivals, up 5%...

    Shares of Pandora (NYSE:P) stay undaunted in the face of competition from larger rivals, up 5% for the day and 50% over the last month. Google's (GOOG +6.3%) plans to launch a music streaming service (audio), Apple's (AAPL +2.3%) new iCloud service, and a bevy of startups have all been labeled Pandora-killers - but for the moment...optimism survives.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • UBNT

    Wireless networking company Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +20%) soars in its first trades following...

    Wireless networking company Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT +20%) soars in its first trades following today's IPO.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • MCHP

    Microchip (MCHP -4.4%) is selling off after yesterday's FQ2 warning, and is leading a few other...

    Microchip (MCHP -4.4%) is selling off after yesterday's FQ2 warning, and is leading a few other analog and mixed-signal chipmakers to underperform the NASDAQ. FCS -4.1%. VSH -1.4%. LLTC -1.4%. ISIL -0.9%. ADI -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (FTNT +4.2%) outperforms after Morgan Keegan declares the provider of security...

    Fortinet (FTNT +4.2%) outperforms after Morgan Keegan declares the provider of security appliances a safe haven in a weak IT spending environment, given how security spending is seen as "mission-critical." Morgan Keegan is also bullish on Fortinet's "strong competitive position" in the growing UTM appliance market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • GSIT

    GSI Technology (GSIT -4.7%) trades down after the company lowered its FYQ2 revenue guidance late...

    GSI Technology (GSIT -4.7%) trades down after the company lowered its FYQ2 revenue guidance late yesterday due to weak Asia demand and slower sales to Cisco (CSCO +1%), its largest customer. It now expects Q2 revenue to come in around $20.8M, below the Street consensus of $22M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • FXY

    The dollar spikes higher against the yen as Dow Jones reports a government official saying Japan...

    The dollar spikes higher against the yen as Dow Jones reports a government official saying Japan will unveil new steps to deal with its strong currency next week.  FXY -0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • XXIA

    Shares of Ixia (XXIA +6.1%) gain after the company grabs the attention of Gabelli, landing a Buy...

    Shares of Ixia (XXIA +6.1%) gain after the company grabs the attention of Gabelli, landing a Buy rating and a lofty $17 price target. It's not a bad day for other networking stocks as well - boosted by a powerhouse Google (GOOG +5.7%) Q3 report. Gainers: EXFO +5.5%, JNPR +2.8%, JDSU +2.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • GOOG

    Analysts continue singing Google's (GOOG +5.9%) praises following Q3 results. Many are noting...

    Analysts continue singing Google's (GOOG +5.9%) praises following Q3 results. Many are noting how mobile advertising is becoming a big business for the search giant, even if ad rates are lower than for PC ads. Mobile games developer Glu Mobile (GLUU +6.9%) and mobile ad provider Motricity (MOTR +6.7%) appear to be rising in sympathy. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • RA-OLD

    RailAmerica (RA-OLD -3.1%) is lower today after saying carload traffic dropped for a sixth...

    RailAmerica (RA-OLD -3.1%) is lower today after saying carload traffic dropped for a sixth consecutive month in September due to lower shipments of coal, its top commodity, and service interruptions related to Hurricane Irene. Separately, Stifel Nicolaus cuts the shares to hold on valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • WLT

    Shares of Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) settle back after a significant premarket runup, and are now...

    Shares of Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) settle back after a significant premarket runup, and are now up 3.5% after yesterday's "rumor of a rumor" circulated by UK's The Independent on a potential takeover unwinds a bit. Shares now trade in-line with other coal stocks (KOL +2.8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • PEGA

    Pegasystems (PEGA +3.4%) rises after Roth's Nathan Schneiderman says checks for the business...

    Pegasystems (PEGA +3.4%) rises after Roth's Nathan Schneiderman says checks for the business process software developer have been "very positive," leading him to boost his revenue and EPS targets. Schneiderman also reports hearing of healthy demand in Europe, and in the financial services vertical, two areas of concern for investors. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • S

    Sprint's (S +4.6%) shares enjoy a boost from Credit Suisse's bullish call, as investors...

    Sprint's (S +4.6%) shares enjoy a boost from Credit Suisse's bullish call, as investors overreacted to the impact of the iPhone and Network Vision on Sprint’s cash flow, leading to heightened liquidity concerns. But the company has access to the capital it needs, CS says, and the "cash drag and funding gap is less than many feared." (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • DTSI

    Shares of DTS (NASDAQ:DTSI) fall 3.6% after getting tagged with a Neutral rating from Collins...

    Shares of DTS (NASDAQ:DTSI) fall 3.6% after getting tagged with a Neutral rating from Collins Stewart with a clipped PT to $30. The firm points to "secular maturity" in the Blu-ray market as threatening future growth prospects for the tech concern.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM

  • Already sharply higher on the day, week, and month in the midst of a massive return back to risk...

    Already sharply higher on the day, week, and month in the midst of a massive return back to risk assets, the euro is in the midst of melting even higher over the past few minutes. The currency has jumped 100 pips in the past few bars, now at $1.3888.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • S

    Premarket gainers: CLWR +10%. GOOG +8%. S +8%. OPK +7%. GLUU +7%. HOV +6%. SWKS +6%. ADBE +5%....

    Premarket gainers: CLWR +10%. GOOG +8%. S +8%. OPK +7%. GLUU +7%. HOV +6%. SWKS +6%. ADBE +5%. BIDU +5%. ERIC +5%. GMCR +5%. ALU +5%. COOL +4%. AMR +4%. RFMD +4%. RENN +4%. SOL +4%. TQNT +4%. HAL +4%. WLT +4%. MT +4%. FCX +4%. SINA +3%. AONE +3%. SIRI +3%. UN +3%. ING +3%. NFLX +3%. MU +3%. F +3%.
    Losers: DEPO -24%. NCMI -23%. AVII -4%. MAT -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ERIC

    Ericsson (NASDAQ:ERIC) gains 4.6% premarket after its Sony Ericsson JV reports a...

    Ericsson (NASDAQ:ERIC) gains 4.6% premarket after its Sony Ericsson JV reports a better-than-expected Q3 profit. Investors could also be encouraged by Sony Ericsson's claim it's shipped 22M Android (NASDAQ:GOOG) phones thus far, and that the average selling price for its phones rose 6% Q/Q, to €166.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • S

    Shares of Sprint (NYSE:S) surge 5.4% higher premarket on reports of euphoria and packed lines on...

    Shares of Sprint (NYSE:S) surge 5.4% higher premarket on reports of euphoria and packed lines on the first day of official iPhone sales. Many Sprint retail stores closed early yesterday to give employees time to prepare for this weekend's expected onslaught.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • GOOG

    A number of Internet stocks are trading higher premarket following Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) Q3...

    A number of Internet stocks are trading higher premarket following Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) Q3 report, which featured encouraging paid click data. AMZN +1.5%. BIDU +4%. OPEN +3%. EBAY +1.6%. NFLX +2%. Netflix could also be getting a lift from the cancellation of rival Hulu's sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 1 Comment

  • U.S. stock index futures motor to new highs following the strong retail sales number. S&P...

    U.S. stock index futures motor to new highs following the strong retail sales number. S&P 500 +1.3%, Nasdaq 100 +1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • AT

    Shares of Atlantic Power (NYSE:AT) slip 2.2% premarket after the company announces a public...

    Shares of Atlantic Power (NYSE:AT) slip 2.2% premarket after the company announces a public offering of 11M shares at a price of $13. The firm says it will use the sale proceeds to fund prior acquisitions and growth opportunities.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 2 Comments
  • GMCR

    Longbow upgrades Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) to a Buy rating on a valuation...

    Longbow upgrades Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) to a Buy rating on a valuation call, and tags the stock with a healthy $112 price target. Shares +2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • GOOG

    Many analysts are lifting their estimates and PTs on Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) following yesterday's...

    Many analysts are lifting their estimates and PTs on Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) following yesterday's Q3 beat. Collins Stewart is raising its target to $795 and reiterating a Buy, citing global online advertising growth, accelerating mobile revenues, display ad sales, and a low valuation. GOOG +7.1% premarket. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • NCMI

    Shares of National CineMedia (NASDAQ:NCMI) sink premarket, down 24%, after the firm lowers its...

    Shares of National CineMedia (NASDAQ:NCMI) sink premarket, down 24%, after the firm lowers its Q4 and FY11 outlook on lower advertising revenue. The company now sees full-year revenue of $425M-$430M, markedly lower than its previous guidance of $460M-$470M. Piper Jaffray piles on following the report, downgrading shares to Overweight and slashing its price target to $15 from $23.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 AM
